content:
I'm not sure if this has already been discussed, but I just learned that AMD has "upper address ignore" (UAI)
https://lwn.net/SubscriberLink/888914/ee7996817255fc1e/

oh nice, ARM has similar stuff for high-bits, and Morello (ARM CHERI) supports them. I am however fuzzy on to what extent a programmer needs to intentionally interop with them and to what extent the cpu/compiler can automagic use them.

Pointerauth is compiler automagic. TBI is cpu magic but generally needs OS support, note that on android TBI is done in such a way that the top byte can never be overwritten by userspace (since you can't get it back): https://source.android.com/devices/tech/debug/tagged-pointers
